group_1.narration: <On the day before Valentine's Day,@Manaka Kurumi was working in the restaurant again,@as though she'd never collapsed the other day to begin with.>
<In sharp contrast to before,@there were value packs of chocolate and@other sweets laid out in the kitchen, and the@creation they planned to make was different as well.>

group_1.textCenter: I think we'll be able to fulfill@this by the end of today.

group_1.narration: Hadn't you decided to turn down the order?

group_1.textCenter: Yes, but the chocolate is going to be finished,@though.

group_1.narration: <She refused to tell me what she was planning.>
<At the scheduled time, the young woman@on the student council arrived at Walnut's.>

group_1.textLeft: To tell you the truth...in the end, we@realized we couldn't make the chocolate.

group_1.textRight: I need to ensure my confession will be successful.

group_1.textLeft: I understand your anger...
But the order was beyond our abilities.
I'm deeply sorry.
Even if we were to make it,@we can never make it more than candy.
You need love, at least,@in order to make a successful confession.
The only love we can imbue it with is@our love towards you and your confession...
We can't recreate the love that@you feel towards the recipient.
Besides, if we put too much@effort into the chocolate itself,
we risk overshadowing the actual confession.
In short, we were never the leading players@in your confession to begin with...
So we gave up.

group_1.textRight: I see.@I suppose there's nothing you can do, then...

group_1.textLeft: No, we can support you.
Yes. Think of it like a picture frame.
If you want a chocolate that guarantees a successful@confession, you're the one who has to make it.
Meanwhile, we at Walnut's will@create the perfect picture frame...
to surround the chocolate that you've made!!

group_1.textRight: So, what you have lined up@here are the ingredients?

group_1.textLeft: Yes!
Miss...?

group_1.textRight: Considering how hard you've worked on this,@you don't have to return the advance.
But since this isn't what I asked for,@would you mind giving me this lesson for free?

group_1.textLeft: Of course!
I've been experimenting with this for a while now,@so I'll help with whatever chocolate you want.
What would you like me to work on?
[chara:300902:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]Hm?!

group_1.textRight: It's the chocolate that Walnut's came up@with to convey my feelings, isn't it?

group_1.textLeft: That's right!

group_1.narration: <Once they made the chocolate,@Walnut's had fulfilled the commission.>

group_1.textRight: Well, I think this is where we'll part ways for today.
Thank you for teaching me how to make this.
And the white chocolate ring@case you made is lovely.

group_1.textLeft: Thank you very much.
Um, are you sure it's alright for us to@take these chocolate rings, too?

group_1.textRight: Plus, you'd never know.@They might come in handy!

group_1.textLeft: We look forward to seeing you again!

group_1.narration: <With the deadline passed,@these frantic days have come to a close.>
<Walnut's, the Western-style restaurant in Hokuyo...@Manaka Kurumi, the only daughter of her family,@at just fourteen years of age...>
<We all look forward to watching her@continue to grow and develop her skillsâ€”@this little girl with great ambition on her shoulders.>
